threat: A remote attacker could create a specially-crafted URL and inject arbitrary headers.
This could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the web server, or to perform a denial of service.
A remote attacker could use this flaw to cause PHP to crash, leading to a denial of service.
special:

In general, a standard system update will make all the necessary changes.
